description: Single storey, 2-bed, detached dwelling with associated parking, bin, and cycle storage, and amenity space
decision_conditions: The proposed dwelling would, by reason of its poor layout, position close to the boundaries of the site and insufficient floor to ceiling height, be of poor quality resulting in substandard accommodation for future residents through lack of internal space and poor outlook, contrary to Policies 7 and 10 of the Havering Local Plan and Policy D6 of the London Plan.

The proposed dwelling would, by reason of its form, excessive depth, scale, bulk, mass, siting and position close to the boundaries of the site, appear dominant and visually intrusive and would be detrimental to the character and appearance of the rear garden environment contrary to Policy 26 of the Havering Local Plan and Policy D4 of the London Plan.

The proposed development would, by reason of the lack of visibility splays, result in inadequate access and egress arrangements harmful to highway and pedestrian safety and the amenity of future occupiers contrary to Policies 10 and 23 of the Havering Local Plan and Policy T4 of the London Plan.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: Consideration was given to seeking amendments, but given conflict with adopted planning policy, notification of intended refusal and the reason(s) for it was given to Form Architecture Ltd via email on 4th November 2022.

Please be advised that approval of this application from 1st September 2019 (either by London Borough of Havering, or subsequently by PINS if allowed on appeal following a refusal by London Borough of Havering) will attract a liability payment of ?£2,550 plus indexation in Community Infrastructure Levy (CIL). This charge has been levied under s.206 of the Planning Act 2008 and includes both the Mayor of London's CIL and Havering Council's CIL.
London Borough of Havering, as CIL collecting authority, has responsibility for the collection of the Mayoral CIL, in addition to Havering's CIL, on commencement of the development.

Your proposal is subject to a CIL Liability Notice indicating a levy of ??£425 plus indexation for the application, based on the Mayoral CIL levy rate for Havering of ??£25/sq.m plus Havering's charging rate for residential of ??£125/sq.m (Zone A)  and the floorspace of 17 square metres.
